AP Photo
By Eliza Collins
7/13/15 5:51 PM EDT
As presidential candidates travel through early states to share their message, a man with bouquets of flowers keeps interrupting them.
On Monday, a bearded man interrupted both Jeb Bush and Rick Perry’s campaign events by giving them bouquets of yellow daisies.
Story Continued Below
Jeb Bush’s communications team used the interruption as a campaigning opportunity — and posted a video of the event titled, “Gov. Jeb Bush Hugs and Says Prayer with Everyday American in Iowa” on its YouTube page.
The video shows Bush talking about how to campaign, when he notices a familiar face in the audience.
“This man was in New Hampshire with me twice last week,” Bush says, pointing out someone off screen. “It’s great to see ya buddy.”
The man, who is wearing a suit and an Abraham Lincoln-style top hat, runs up to Bush and presents him with a bunch of flowers.
“How many prayers am I going to have to do this time?” Bush asks.
“You offered 20 prayers last time,” the man says.
“I did them,” Bush confirms.
“This just for your wife,” the man says, then he asks for one prayer for peace in person.
Also on POLITICO
ADAM B. LERNER
“Dear Lord, we do need a peaceful world, we need American leadership to make sure that there is peace all around the world. I worry about people that are, that are struggling in their lives, and a more peaceful world will allow them to rise up,” Bush says.
As Bush prays, the man holds a daisy in his mouth. At the end of the prayer, Bush goes in for a handshake, but the man embraces him.
Another video posted Monday shows Perry getting interrupted by the same man during a question and answer session at a round table-style event in Iowa.
“Last time I saw you I offered you one flower for peace…and you accepted it. This time I wondered if I could offer you 20 flowers for peace?” the man — in this case without the top hat — says.
Perry interrupts to say he remembers him from New Hampshire.
After handing him the bouquet, the man asks for a peace prayer for each flower.
“Go over there,” Perry says. “I’ll silently pray for you right now, brother. How about that?”
By DOUG SOSNIK

title: 'Flower man' interrupts Jeb Bush, Rick Perry in Iowa
